column4: I had a lot of problems and when I was updating to 11.04 something messed up and everything broke and I couldnt get anything to work. So i deleted it and reinstalled 10.04...now I can't get my computer to recognize my wireless internet card. Its a BCM4311 and I know how to set it up, but it won't even see it under lspci?
do a clean install of natty instead :)
Is there a reason my computer won't recognize my wireless card anymore?
does it show in:  sudo lshw -C network
Nope, just my direct connection
I had to partition everything myself when reinstalling because 11.04 was on there and i had to delete that and format the partition, I set the mount point at / for 10.04, would that mess anything up?
can't see that being an issue
is there a switch to turn the wifi off and on
there is a button on the laptop, but ive hit it several times and nothing ;/
reboot and run:  dmesg | less     and read through, is the wireless device detected?
nope, no wireless card was detected
Maybe i will download natty onto a cd and perform a clean install and try again ugh
and that's in a Lucid install
yes lucid, it has always worked before also
very strange
yep, maybe this button needs to be pressed on startup or something, ill mess around with it ;) Thanks anyways
I got it working now ;D I booted into windows, turned the wireless on, then booted back into linux and it worked.
cool, I suggest you go into device manager and tell windows to not allow the device to wake up the OS, and disable power management on it
which release?
http://www.multimediaboom.com/how-to-install-java-in-ubuntu-11-04-natty-narwhal-ppa/
that ppa has a later version :)
